original_title: Japanese foreign minister on two day Sri Lanka visit
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Japan’s Foreign Minister Hayashi Yoshimasa will arrive in Sri Lanka on July 28 on a two-day official visit, the President’s media office said.
The Minister will have discussions with Sri Lanka Foreign Minister M UM Ali Sabry, the embassy of Japan said.
Japan is a key partner in Sri Lanka’s debt re-structuring efforts.
Japan has funded Sri Lanka’s roads, ports, infrastructure and also given grant aid to the health sector for many years. (Colombo/July28/2023)
